## Classes Index

<MembersIndexItem
  type="struct"
  name={<><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/logicalresult">LogicalResult</a></>}>

</MembersIndexItem>

<MembersIndexItem
  type="class"
  name={<><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/failureor">FailureOr&lt;T&gt;</a></>}>
This class provides support for representing a failure result, or a valid value of type <code>T</code>. <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/failureor/#details">More...</a>
</MembersIndexItem>

<MembersIndexItem
  type="class"
  name={<><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/parseresult">ParseResult</a></>}>
This class represents success/failure for parsing-like operations that find it important to chain together failable operations with <code>||</code>. <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/parseresult/#details">More...</a>
</MembersIndexItem>

</MembersIndex>

<Link id="l00016" /><CodeLine lineNumber="16"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This class represents an efficient way to signal success or failure. It</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00017" /><CodeLine lineNumber="17"><Highlight kind="comment">/// should be preferred over the use of &#96;bool&#96; when appropriate, as it avoids</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00018" /><CodeLine lineNumber="18"><Highlight kind="comment">/// all of the ambiguity that arises in interpreting a boolean result. This</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00019" /><CodeLine lineNumber="19"><Highlight kind="comment">/// class is marked as NODISCARD to ensure that the result is processed. Users</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00020" /><CodeLine lineNumber="20"><Highlight kind="comment">/// may explicitly discard a result by using &#96;(void)&#96;, e.g.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00021" /><CodeLine lineNumber="21"><Highlight kind="comment">/// &#96;(void)functionThatReturnsALogicalResult();&#96;. Given the intended nature of</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00022" /><CodeLine lineNumber="22"><Highlight kind="comment">/// this class, it generally shouldn&#39;t be used as the result of functions that</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00023" /><CodeLine lineNumber="23"><Highlight kind="comment">/// very frequently have the result ignored. This class is intended to be used</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00024" /><CodeLine lineNumber="24"><Highlight kind="comment">/// in conjunction with the utility functions below.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="25" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/logicalresult"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">struct </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">&#91;&#91;nodiscard&#93;&#93; LogicalResult &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="26"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">public</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">:</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="27"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// If isSuccess is true a &#96;success&#96; result is generated, otherwise a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// &#39;failure&#39; result is generated.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/logicalresult/#ac3732ee5a111ea78dec325ea8c561fa8"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> LogicalResult <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/logicalresult/#ac3732ee5a111ea78dec325ea8c561fa8">success</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> IsSuccess = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">true</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="101"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Wrap a value on the success path in a FailureOr of the same value type.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="102"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">template</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &lt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">typename</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/mips/mips16isellowering-cpp/#a0acb682b8260ab1c60b918599864e2e5">T</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="104" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ae2fa50a7ec05cbf26bd9d5bb8abd5b22"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">inline</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a6ea6fb3a4e8248113053829b7fd89c96a260ca9dd8a4577fc00b7bd5810298076">success</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/mips/mips16isellowering-cpp/#a0acb682b8260ab1c60b918599864e2e5">T</a> &amp;&amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/tablegen/tablegenbackendskeleton-cpp/#a262774d3e5186511427e5b2414a85f7f">Y</a>) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="105"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/failureor">FailureOr&lt;std::decay&#95;t&lt;T&gt;</a>&gt;(std::forward&lt;T&gt;(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/tablegen/tablegenbackendskeleton-cpp/#a262774d3e5186511427e5b2414a85f7f">Y</a>));</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="106"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="107"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="108"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This class represents success/failure for parsing-like operations that find</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="109"><Highlight kind="comment">/// it important to chain together failable operations with &#96;||&#96;.  This is an</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="110"><Highlight kind="comment">/// extended version of &#96;LogicalResult&#96; that allows for explicit conversion to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="111"><Highlight kind="comment">/// bool.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="112"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="113"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This class should not be used for general error handling cases - we prefer</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="114"><Highlight kind="comment">/// to keep the logic explicit with the &#96;succeeded&#96;/&#96;failed&#96; predicates.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="115"><Highlight kind="comment">/// However, traditional monadic-style parsing logic can sometimes get</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="116"><Highlight kind="comment">/// swallowed up in boilerplate without this, so we provide this for narrow</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="117"><Highlight kind="comment">/// cases where it is important.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="118"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="119" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/parseresult"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">&#91;&#91;nodiscard&#93;&#93; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/parseresult/#a1c8e93421614220a28c4c685de257b15">ParseResult</a> : </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">public</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> LogicalResult &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="120"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">public</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="121" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/parseresult/#a1c8e93421614220a28c4c685de257b15"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/parseresult/#a1c8e93421614220a28c4c685de257b15">ParseResult</a>(LogicalResult Result = <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/logicalresult/#ac3732ee5a111ea78dec325ea8c561fa8">success</a>()) : LogicalResult(Result) &#123;&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="122"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="123"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Failure is true in a boolean context.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="124" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/parseresult/#a08d8feb4584f75764e82340ac35ac9a5"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">constexpr</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">explicit</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">operator</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> bool()</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword"> const </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">&#123; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/logicalresult/#ab2850b11db804ad8b3f8fdc05c692619">failed</a>(); &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="125"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
